figureCitation.captionText: Figure 27. Cryptelytrops insularis. Female (USNM [CMD 594], SVL 684 mm, TL 784 mm) from the flood plain of Lake Ira Lalaro, Lautem District. Photo by Hinrich Kaiser.

subSubSection.paragraph: (E) Lesser Sunda Island Pitviper, Island Pitviper, Lesser Sunda White-lipped Pitviper. (T) Samodok. (Mambae) Samor. (Fataluku) Cuale.

This species was regarded as a subspecies of the widespread Asian species
Trimeresurus albolabris
until it was elevated to full species rank by Giannasi et al. (2001) . Malhotra and Thorpe (2004) changed the generic assignment from
Trimeresurus
to
Cryptelytrops
in their revision of Asian pitvipers.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 27.
Cryptelytrops insularis
. Female (USNM [CMD 594], SVL 684 mm, TL 784 mm) from the flood plain of Lake Ira Lalaro, Lautem District. Photo by Hinrich Kaiser.
